title: Atlético Clube Izabelense
text:
Atlético Clube Izabelense, commonly known as Izabelense, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Santa%20Isabel%20do%20Par%C3%A1">Santa Isabel do Pará</a>, <a href="Par%C3%A1">Pará state</a>. It competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> twice.
History.
The club was founded on April 26, 1924. It competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> in <a href="1981%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1981</a>, when it was eliminated in the Third Stage of the competition, and in <a href="1992%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1992</a>, when it was eliminated in the First Stage.
Stadium.
Atlético Clube Izabelense plays its home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Ed%C3%ADlson%20Abreu">Estádio Edílson Abreu</a>. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 3,000 people.
